Message:
Freshly spilled blood—
my blood—spread in slow waves,
its heat melting the fallen snow.

With the remainder of
my fading consciousness,
I attended to the collapsed
witch’s wounds.

From her inner pocket, I found
a list of orders and a letter.
The letter was scrawled with
a simple message from
a sender called, “Mother.”

It was just as I’d feared.
She was being used...
exactly as I had been.

That must mean...
the most important person
to this girl was also...already...

According to the list,
the girl’s next target after me...
wasn’t a witch.
Her target was the Duke of Fran—

a man who saves witches
and fights together with
them against the Church.

I see... So there’s still
something I can do.
Something I must do.

The Church’s Inquisition—
the perpetrators of my deception...

The ones...who had murdered
my grandfather...and my sister...!

I’ll hunt each and
every one of them down.

Holding on to my steadily
waning consciousness with
my welling anger as fuel,

I headed into the forest’s
depths step by limping step.

The trail of my footprints
was slowly covered by
the snow falling overhead.
